todos.title: Engage with University
todos.body: Partner with professors, contact university career offices, go to entrepreneur and other events.

todos.title: Managing
todos.body: Your time should appear less important than team’s, care about helping others, listen, don’t be afraid to correct behavior, trust others, be patient, confidence, presence.

todos.title: Make Your Company Attractive
todos.body: What is your presence, curb appeal, website, first impression, culture, about us page, CEO bio.

todos.title: Small Teams
todos.body: The larger the teams the more combinations of communications that will be required.

todos.title: Less But Better
todos.body: Take a sniper approach.  Look for les but better qualified recruits.

todos.title: Proactive about Rewards
todos.body: Surprise people with rewards, it will mean more.

todos.title: Fight for Your Team
todos.body: Show them you have their back.

todos.title: Course Hero’s Principles
todos.body: Ship early and often, only one project at a time, testing is a first class problem (should never be shortchanged) , communicate openly and freely, always be recruiting.

todos.title: Reward Recruiting
todos.body: Reward your internal team to recruit for you.  Every department should be involved in recruiting.

todos.title: Always be recruiting
todos.body: Recruiting never stops.

todos.title: Hire Recruiter
todos.body: Recruiters should support the process, not replace it.  Stay actively involved in the process.

todos.title: 10x Programmer
todos.body: Programmer that is 10x better than the next.

todos.title: Grind
todos.body: Prepare yourself for the grind.  It’s about building relationships.  Make recruiting a habit, each day start making relationships with qualified people, search on social sites, ask around about candidates, post jobs.

todos.title: Spending
todos.body: Plan to spend at least $10,000, 100 hours of your time, or a combination of the two to recruit a new hire.

todos.title: Warning Signs of Losing Confidence
todos.body: People try to solve problems without you, people go around you, complaining, stop seeking you out for help.

todos.title: Technical v. Managerial Leadership
todos.body: Pay attention to both and their synergies.

todos.title: Outsource/In-source
todos.body: Outsourcing is not discouraged but remember to develop the knowledge, skill, systems and tools to recruit internally.

todos.title: Spread Search
todos.body: Look outside local area.

todos.title: Project Focus
todos.body: Keep everyone focused on one thing until complete.

todos.title: Know Where to Look
todos.body: In your office, from good school, looking for a job, passionate about product or market, highly experienced in your skill.

todos.title: Know Why
todos.body: If you don’t get a candidate don’t quit until you know why.

todos.title: Make Interviews Fun
todos.body: Give tour, give goodies, bring them into activities, ask interesting questions.

todos.title: Strategy for Visas
todos.body: Get an immigration attorney, expect to pay $10,000.

todos.title: Feature Toggles
todos.body: Feature that you can activate at any given time.

todos.title: Experience Not Needed
todos.body: Experience can be taught.

todos.title: Visas
todos.body: Don’t be afraid to hire abroad.  It costs about $10,000 to go through visa process.

todos.title: Hiring Decision Checklist
todos.body: Do they fit culture, are they smart, are they teachable, what will they work on first 90 days, what is their ceiling potential, how do they make us better, are they fun to work around.

todos.title: Design Stages
todos.body: Design ready, design in progress, technical architecture review, development ready, development in progress, code review, quality assurance, launch.

todos.title: Develop Training Program
todos.body: Core Principles of Company and Purpose, Workflow, Pair Programming and shadowing, Outline Projects, Introduce Support Structure.

todos.title: Grow Yourself
todos.body: Constantly ask the team how you could do better.

todos.title: Top Ten Computer Science Schools
todos.body: Carnegie Mellon, MIT, Stanford, UC Berkeley, University of Illinois – Urbana Champaign, Cornell, University of Washington, Princeton, Georgia Institute of Tech., University of Texas – Austin.

todos.title: Attributes to look for
todos.body: Candidate has something to teach you, love programming and technology, pleasant to be around, teachable, takes pride in their work, thinks entrepreneurially.

todos.title: Ship Constantly
todos.body: Build self sustaining pieces that can be shipped.

todos.title: Break Things Down
todos.body: Break large projects into small chunks.

todos.title: Sites
todos.body: angel.co, linkedin.com, weworkremotely.com, news.ycombinator.com

todos.title: People
todos.body: Do everything to work with great people, go where the great people are.
